p: Outpatient diarrheal demographics also differed significantly between the wet and dry seasons ( Table 4). While no difference in sex distribution could be detected, the wet season had significantly more patients between the ages of 1 and 4 years ( p < 0.001), and the dry season had significantly more patients 5 years and over ( p < 0.001). There was no seasonal difference in the number of diarrhea case reports for children less than 1 year old. Diarrheal type also varied by season ( p < 0.001).
